title: Evercore ISI Cuts Augmedix (NASDAQ:AUGX) Price Target to $4.50
text:
Augmedix (NASDAQ:AUGX - Get Free Report) had its price objective dropped by Evercore ISI from $6.50 to $4.50 in a report released on Tuesday, Benzinga reports. The brokerage currently has an "in-line" rating on the stock. Evercore ISI's price objective indicates a potential upside of 13.64% from the company's current price. Separately, Maxim Group reduced their price target on shares of Augmedix from $6.50 to $5.00 and set a "buy" rating for the company in a report on Tuesday. Get Our Latest Analysis on Augmedix Shares of Augmedix stock traded up $0.63 on Tuesday, hitting $3.96. The company had a trading volume of 1,086,009 shares, compared to its average volume of 393,943. The firm has a market capitalization of $163.79 million, a P/E ratio of -7.76 and a beta of -0.14. Augmedix has a twelve month low of $1.34 and a twelve month high of $6.25. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 17.18, a current ratio of 1.34 and a quick ratio of 1.34. The stock has a 50-day moving average of $4.41 and a 200-day moving average of $4.94. Large investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the business. Essex Investment Management Co. LLC bought a new stake in Augmedix during the third quarter worth $2,237,000. Acadian Asset Management LLC bought a new stake in Augmedix during the third quarter worth $48,000. Barclays PLC bought a new stake in Augmedix during the third quarter worth $115,000. Vontobel Holding Ltd. raised its position in Augmedix by 439.7% during the third quarter. Vontobel Holding Ltd. now owns 173,209 shares of the company's stock worth $892,000 after acquiring an additional 141,113 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Worth Venture Partners LLC bought a new stake in Augmedix during the third quarter worth $83,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 71.58% of the company's stock. Augmedix, Inc provides remote medical documentation solutions and live clinical support services in the United States. Its platform offers Augmedix Live that provides synchronous medical note documentation and point of care support; Augmedix Notes that offers asynchronous medical documentation based upon previously recorded visits; Augmedix Prep that provides patient demographics, past medical history, medication changes and other points from the patient's health record; and Augmedix Go, a self-service mobile software application.Featured StoriesFive stocks we like better than AugmedixWhat Are Dividend Challengers?Growing Twice as Fast as Tesla, XPeng is a BuyThe How and Why of Investing in Biotech Stocks4 Stocks Building Long-Term Value for Shareholders Best Stocks Under $10.00 FedEx Stock Has Analysts Upgrading in Bulk, a Sudden Discount Before you consider Augmedix, you'll want to hear this.
